alert.note: Alert for Anasco; Las Marias; Mayaguez; San Sebastian (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 19 at 2:58AM ADT until September 19 at 9:00AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Anasco County in Puerto Rico... Las Marias County in Puerto Rico... Mayaguez County in Puerto Rico... San Sebastian County in Puerto Rico... * Until 800 AM AST Monday. * At 158 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is up to 0.75 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of mainstem rivers including the Rio Guanajibo and Rio Grande del Anasco as well as creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Rio Guanajibo has exceeded the major flood stage at 28.12 feet. Around the river residences are being flooded as well as a number of roads made impassable including highways 114, 347 and 309. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Anasco; Las Marias; Mayaguez; San Sebastian
